channel.title: PrestaShop on PrestaShop Developers' blog
channel.description: Recent content in PrestaShop on PrestaShop Developers' blog

item.title: PrestaShop Project Newsletter Launch: Stay Informed!
item.description: At PrestaShop, we are always looking for ways to strengthen our relationship with the community. In line with this, we are thrilled to announce the launch of the PrestaShop Project Newsletter, a new initiative designed to bring you technical insights, exclusive updates, and educational content like never before. The launch of this newsletter is happening now, and the timing is no coincidence! With the PrestaShop Developer Conference just around the corner on November 6, 2024, we want to highlight our commitment to the technical community.

item.title: Register Now for the PrestaShop Developer Conference 2024
item.description: The world of ecommerce is constantly evolving, and staying on top of the latest trends and innovations is essential for developers and businesses. That’s why we are thrilled to invite you to the second edition of the PrestaShop Developer Conference, taking place on November 6, 2024, in Paris. Why Attend the Conference? The PrestaShop Developer Conference is more than just a series of presentations - it’s a space where passionate developers come together to exchange ideas, learn from one another, and engage with some of the leading voices in the PrestaShop community.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.2 Is Available
item.description: It’s been decided to release a new minor version of PrestaShop 8.2. This version includes a few improvements, as well as bug fixes. What’s new in PrestaShop 8.2? PrestaShop 8.2 is a minor version that includes a few improvements, as well as bug fixes, and it is relatively small compared to the previous minor versions. Here are some highlights. Improvements Correctly checking overrides during module installation PrestaShop used to check for overrides during module installation, but the process didn’t fully block installation if a conflicting override was found.

item.title: Second PrestaShop Developer Conference - Participate as a Speaker
item.description: Are you a passionate PrestaShop developer or enthusiast? We are happy to announce that the call for presentations is now open for the second edition of the PrestaShop Developer Conference, happening on November 6, 2024 in Paris, France. This event offers a prime opportunity to engage in developer discussions, better understand solutions, and connect with fellow community members. What is this event about? The PrestaShop Developer Conference empowers the developer community within the PrestaShop ecosystem.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1.7 Is Available
item.description: A new patch for PrestaShop 8.1 is now available! This release includes several significant improvements and numerous bug fixes. In this article, we’ll explore these updates in detail. PrestaShop 8.1.7 is now available. This release addresses several bugs and brings various improvements. It is recommended to upgrade your shop quickly in order to benefit from these fixes. Of course, don’t forget to backup before. Upgrade is possible using the latest version of the 1-Click Upgrade module.

item.title: PrestaShop 9 Alpha 1 is Available!
item.description: Here it is. The first public alpha of PrestaShop 9 is available. We decided it was time to share with you the first results of our work on PrestaShop 9. Please note that this version is in the early stages of development. To achieve a stable release, we anticipate several months of further work. As we are prior to the feature-freeze phase, the features and content of PrestaShop 9 are subject to change.

item.title: Simplifying releases with a single Zip
item.description: As we continue to evolve and adapt to the global e-commerce landscape, we are implementing changes to streamline our operations and enhance our project’s trajectory. In 2022, we aimed to make PrestaShop a company-neutral open source project. Today, while keeping the project neutral, we are changing how we distribute the PrestaShop solution, starting with the upcoming 9.0 release. One release, one Zip As you know, versions are distributed as two separate Zips, one on GitHub and a later one on prestashop.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1.6 Is Available
item.description: A new patch version for PrestaShop 8.1 is now available. This maintenance release fixes 2 security issues. The security patch for version 8.1 of PrestaShop is now available. It is recommended that you upgrade your shop quickly in order to benefit from these fixes. Of course, don’t forget to create a backup before. You can upgrade to the latest version using the 1-Click Upgrade module. There are no database changes in this release.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1.5 Is Available
item.description: Another patch for PrestaShop 8.1 is available. This release contains interesting improvements as well as a number of bug fixes. In this article, we’ll lean into them because there’s plenty to write about! PrestaShop 8.1.5 is available. This release fixes some bugs but also brings a lot of improvements. It is recommended to upgrade your shop quickly in order to benefit from these fixes. Of course, don’t forget to backup before.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1.4 Is Available
item.description: It’s been decided to release a security patch for version 8.1 of PrestaShop. The security patch for version 8.1 of PrestaShop is now available. This is the first release where it’s been decided to separate the security fixes from other bug fixes and improvements, allowing for a quick release of the security patch. It is recommended that you upgrade your shop quickly in order to benefit from these fixes. Of course, don’t forget to create a backup before.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1.3 Is Available
item.description: We are entering the new year with the release of PrestaShop 8.1.3. The latest update for PrestaShop 8.1 is now available. This version brings two security updates, addresses close to 30 known issues, and introduces various enhancements. To welcome the new year well, we are releasing a new version of PrestaShop! Version 8.1.3 is available with a slight delay, but this is due to the time it took to complete work on it.

item.title: PrestaShop 1.7.8.11 Is Available
item.description: A security patch for PrestaShop 1.7 is now available. As part of the extended support policy for PrestaShop 1.7, which involves taking care of critical and security fixes for the 1.7.8.x branch, we are releasing today a new patch for this version. This release fixes one high severity security issue found by security researchers. For more details regarding security fixes, you can check the security advisories section below. It is recommended to upgrade your shop quickly in order to benefit from these fixes.

item.title: New Branding For The Project
item.description: This week will see some changes with the Project. PrestaShop SA, the company, is making the open source Project consistent with the new PrestaShop branding. New PrestaShop Project branding Unveiled earlier this year, PrestaShop launched its new brand identity to affirm PrestaShop’s strengths, showing more credibility and trust. Therefore, in the next few days, to align with this new identity, all materials related to the Project will change. You’ll see the rebranded Project’s website, developer documentation, this blog, and other Project-related content.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1.2 is available
item.description: The second patch for PrestaShop 8.1 is available! This release contains 2 security fixes, over 30 bugs have been fixed and some minor improvements have been integrated. Version 8.1.2 fixes a few security issues found by security researchers and solves a great number of bugs reported by the community and project’s Quality Assurance team. It also includes some minor improvements, especially for the new product page and new multi-format image generation system.

item.title: Hacktoberfest 2023
item.description: The month of October is coming quickly! So be prepared for Hacktoberfest, a month-long celebration of open source software. Hacktoberfest 2023 The online event has been happening every October since 2013 and is sponsored by DigitalOcean. This year marks the 10th anniversary of the event, with changes to help ensure its sustainability for the next decade. You’ll learn about these right below. How can you participate? Very simple: people are encouraged to create at least 4 pull requests for open source projects on GitHub.
